title: Berkshire Live: Wednesday 11 January - BBC News
summary: ex-windsor grammar teacher on trial for abuse .
tributes to man killed in crash near legoland .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thank you for joining us again today .
we 'll be back tomorrow at 08:00 with all berkshire 's latest news , travel , weather and sport .
you can stay in touch via our facebook and twitter pages .

documents.title: snow or no snow ?
text: weather presenter alexis green says there is a `` great deal of uncertainty '' over the chance of snow in the south tomorrow .
she says : `` we have all the ingredients for snow - intense rain , cold air from the north and the right wind direction .
`` but it is less likely along the coast where it will be warmer .
more likely for areas north of the m4 .
`` the uncertainty is about the track and intensity of the weather system , meaning that confidence is low in the amount and extent of any snow . ''
author: Alexis Green
BBC South Today weather presenter

documents.title: dh lawrence letter calling pangbourne 'smelly ' sells for £ 1,000
text: a letter written by dh lawrence describing a berkshire village as repulsive and smelly has sold for £ 1,000 at auction .
the author of lady chatterley 's lover maligned pangbourne while inquiring about cottages to let in 1919 .
he wrote : `` women use scent on their clothes , and petrol plus river plus pavement i suffer by the nose . ''
the note was auctioned by lyon and turnbull in edinburgh earlier today .
author: Toby Wadey
BBC South

documents.title: reading v qpr : latest team news
text: reading will remain without captain paul mcshane for the visit of qpr tomorrow night as the central defender continues to recover from a wrist injury .
winger callum harriott sustained a hamstring injury before the new year and will be out for up to six weeks .
the royals will be looking to bounce back from their 4-0 fa cup defeat by manchester united and put pressure on championship top two newcastle and brighton .
read more here .
author: Adam Williams
BBC Sport

documents.title: elderly man 's wallet snatched by bogus delivery man
text: an 89-year-old had his wallet snatched by a thief posing as a delivery man in slough .
the offender knocked on the door of the property in mirador crescent on sunday night , telling his victim he had a parcel for his neighbour .
this , he claimed , had been thrown into the victim 's back garden by mistake .
once inside the house , the bogus delivery man asked the victim to check he had his wallet as he did not want to be accused of stealing it - before snatching it from his hand .
the offender is described as white , around 30 years of age , stocky and with thick dark hair .
he was wearing dark clothing .
thames valley police said the incident had left the victim `` shaken '' and is appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: weather watcher hungerford and windsor
text: our bbc weather watchers in berkshire have been taking some great photos today .
these are from ken in hungerford and mandy in windsor .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: roadworks causing delays in ascot
text: roadworks causing delays in ascot

documents.title: rolf harris trial : inside the courtroom
text: this is a highly unusual case .
a man who achieved fame and fortune through television is on trial via a screen .
we 've got used to seeing `` celebrity '' defendants arriving at court for high profile cases .
often they 're flanked by family and friends .
some try to avoid the cameras , others stop to pose for
rolf harris does n't have to run the gauntlet in that way .
he is n't actually here in the courtroom on london 's south bank .
instead he is watching and listening to proceedings over a video link .
everybody in court can see him , sat at a desk , smartly dressed in a dark suit , white shirt and tie .
occasionally he puts his head in his hands , sometimes he takes his glasses off to rub his eyes .

despite his 86 years , the white hair and neatly trimmed beard make him instantly recognisable , somehow even more so because he appears - as most of us are used to seeing him - on a screen , fixed to the courtroom wall .
read more here .
author: Dan Johnson
BBC News

documents.title: armed officers at awe 'made to feel to blame ' for failings
text: special armed police who guard the atomic weapons establishment in burghfield were made to feel they were blamed for the failings of their senior commanders , according to an independent inquiry .
a ministry of defence investigation into police patrols at awe resulted in more than 50 officers leaving the force or facing misconduct proceedings .
but now a report by a member of the mod police committee has found that officers further up the chain of command were not considered for disciplinary action .
the ministry of defence said its police officers are held to the highest standards and on the rare occasion when these are not met , disciplinary action is taken .
it added that there was never any threat to the safety or security of the awe burghfield and aldermaston sites .

documents.title: can we expect the first snow of 2017 ?
text: have a listen to the latest expert prediction , as the met office warns of snow in berkshire tomorrow .
rain is likely to turn to snow , but it 's borderline .

documents.title: council fears 'significant impact ' of building plan
text: plans to build 250 new homes on the south oxfordshire border are expected to be opposed by reading councillors later .
the authority says developing the site at peppard road in emmer green would have a significant impact on surrounding infrastructure '' .
in its design and access statement , gladman developments said its plans would `` create a sensitively designed and high quality place '' .
it added that this would `` complement the existing character of emmer green '' .
read reading borough council 's report on the plans here .

documents.title: 'my mum realised what i 'd done and called police '
text: michael longsmith from reading has spent six of the last 10 years in prison .
born into a family of criminals , his earliest memories are of the police breaking down the door of the family home .
now he 's turned his life around - as he told me this morning on bbc radio berkshire .
author: Sarah Walker
BBC Radio Berkshire

documents.title: weather latest : dry and breezy afternoon ahead
text: berkshire will stay dry this afternoon , with cloud increasing later .
temperatures are expected to fall to 4c overnight , with a chance of frost in the morning .
the met office has issued a weather warning for snow tomorrow .

documents.title: rolf harris sex assault trial begins
text: the trial of former entertainer rolf harris on charges of indecent assault and sexual assault against seven women and girls has begun at southwark crown court .
a jury of seven women and five men , selected on monday , has been sworn in .
the 86-year-old , who used to live in bray , has pleaded not guilty to all charges .
he will appear via a video link from stafford prison during the trial , which is expected to last five weeks .

text: a woman reported missing from bracknell has been found safe and well .

the force said it would like to thank the public for their assistance .

as skies clear on thursday night there is also potential for widespread ice to form quite rapidly on untreated surfaces .

documents.title: rogue trader jailed after scamming elderly
text: a rogue trader who scammed 11 people out of hundreds of thousands of pounds has been jailed for two years .
david reed , 59 , pleaded guilty to 24 counts of fraud totalling £ 200,000 .
his son adam , 31 , was also involved and received 100 hours of unpaid work .
both of nine mile ride , finchampshead , wokingham , pleaded guilty at reading crown court on thursday .
david reed was the director of able building and roofing services ( abrs ) ltd where his son adam was also employed .
together they targeted vulnerable people to carry out work at their properties , significantly overcharging significantly for the work , police said .
in one example they charged a total of £ 41,840 for some roofing work , when the actual cost was between £ 10,000 and £ 15,000 .
the investigation identified 11 victims based in berkshire , who had been significantly overcharged and not told of their rights to cancel .
author: Sarah Lee
BBC South

documents.title: habitat loss and climate change hitting english birds and butterflies
text: english birds and butterflies are being hit by a combination of habitat loss and climate change that could see species vanishing from some areas , scientists from the university of reading have warned .
a number of cold-climate birds , including the meadow pipit , willow tit and willow warbler have already been lost from locations where they once thrived , it is claimed .
while some butterflies that enjoy warmer conditions , such as the speckled wood , have migrated north , cold-loving insects are not faring well , said the experts .
modern farming methods have led to widespread loss of natural habitats , forcing both birds and butterflies to find new homes .
but climate change means that not all species can easily re-locate , said the researchers , who analysed four decades-worth of bird and butterfly records from more than 600 english monitoring sites .
bird communities are struggling to successfully adapt to the warming we 've had over recent decades .

although butterflies are coping much better , in both cases a lack of natural habitat in our landscapes is putting cold-associated species between a rock and a hard place by limiting their ability to find resources and survive . ''
author: Sarah Lee
BBC South

documents.title: reading university 's 'biggles ' ww1 hall saved from demolition
text: a victorian hall used to train world war one air cadets , including the pilot who created the fictional flying ace biggles , has been saved from demolition .
following council plans to list pearson court as a `` heritage asset '' , a planning application to knock it down has been withdrawn by reading university .
the victorian society , mp rob wilson and alumni also campaigned to save it .
the university said the new plans would seek to preserve the campus ' heritage .
revised plans for new student halls , designed to meet the growing demand for on-campus accommodation , are due to go on display later this month .
during the first world war st patrick 's hall was used by the royal flying corps , the raf 's precursor , to house cadets at the no 1 school of aeronautics .
the author and ww1 pilot , william earl johns , is thought to have based the book biggles learns to fly on his time in reading , where he gained his flying certificate at coley park .
author: Emma Midgley
BBC South

documents.title: legoland crash cyclist a 'family man '
text: legoland crash cyclist a 'family man '

documents.title: tribute to cyclist killed near legoland in windsor
text: a cyclist who was killed in a crash nearthe legoland theme park has been described as `` a staunch family man '' .
fred dowling , 52 , from wokingham , was in an accident involving a silver vw transporter van on winkfield road , windsor on the morning of 5 january .
in a statement , his family said he had left behind a wife and two daughters .
they added that `` with his very outgoing personality and quirky sense of humour '' , he had over the years given them many happy memories .
author: Sarah Lee
BBC South

documents.title: swansea last u23 side left in efl trophy
text: reading , leicester city and brighton 's development teams all exited the competition after away losses .

documents.title: driver who moved ambulance for parking space 'had no regard for crew '
text: a car driver who moved an ambulance which was blocking a parking space , while staff were in the back carrying out emergency treatment had no regard for the crew who were treating a patient '' , south central ambulance said .
the offender released the handbrake before parking in the space on pelican lane , newbury , on 29 december .
darren weston , who was the on-call manager for south central ambulance said the man 's actions were extremely dangerous '' as the patient was being treated for a life threatening medical concern .
i ca n't emphasise the gravity of the situation .
if that vehicle had rolled forward and hit somebody , the crew would have been helpless in the back and unable to stop that moving the ambulance . ''
author: Sarah Lee
BBC South

documents.title: concern for missing woman , 76
text: police are becoming `` increasingly concerned '' for the welfare of a missing woman from bracknell .
valerie davies , 76 , was last seen in calfridus way , bracknell , at about 15:00 gmt on tuesday .
valerie is described white , 4ft 8ins , slim , with short blonde hair and blue eyes .
when she was last seen she was wearing reading glasses , a green parka jacket , jeans and black and white converse trainers .

documents.title: ex-windsor grammar teacher 'abused boys over a decade '
text: a former teacher carried out a string of sex attacks on boys for more than a decade , a court has heard .
patrick marshall , 70 , denies carrying out the abuse while working at windsor grammar school in berkshire and st paul 's school in london .
southwark crown court was told 24 offences against at least nine boys occurred between 1969 and 1981 .
one witness told the trial he `` lay there quietly '' while he was assaulted by the married father-of-three .
he said the former geography teacher and rowing coach attacked him several times at a `` secluded '' building used by the school .
`` i just felt intense discomfort .
i did not know how to stop it from happening , '' he said .
author: Toby Wadey
BBC South

documents.title: today 's weather : colder weather with some cloud
text: it 's a relatively mild morning with some sunshine but it will feel colder thanks to a brisk wind .
there 's the chance of cloud and a few showers , but nothing too out of the ordinary .
tomorrow there is a yellow warning out to expect snow later in the afternoon , which could cause some tricky traffic conditions .

documents.title: good morning !
text: good morning from all of us here at bbc berkshire .
there will be some early cloud and patchy rain clearing quickly this morning , becoming brighter , colder and windy through the day .
we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , travel and weather until 18:00 .
author: Sarah Lee
BBC South
